channel.title: Ruby on Rails - topdan.com
channel.description: Dan Cunning's thoughts on Ruby on Rails.

item.title: Browsing Files & Directories in S3
item.description: Amazon's S3 makes storing files easy but viewing directories isn't intuitive. Let me explain how you can emulate a file structure using Plain-Old-Ruby-Objects.

item.title: Progress Bars
item.description: How to create a progress bar using Ruby on Rails, AJAX, and Twitter Bootstrap.

item.title: f.label and errors.full_messages
item.description: Why you should never use the explicit "content" parameter of label_tag or the form builder's label method.

item.title: Time Zones and datetime_select
item.description: A simple fix for using datetime_select and time_zone_select together.

item.title: views/mailers directory
item.description: Avoid cluttering up app/views by moving mailer directories underneath a single parent.

item.title: Mailing Lists
item.description: Mailing lists remain an effective way for groups to communicate. We'll explore how to implement them in your Rails application to improve its overall user-experience.

item.title: Beware ActiveRecord callbacks
item.description: ActiveRecord is a fantastically well-made ORM that makes working with databases a breeze, but one feature in the callback structure is incredibly bug-prone.

item.title: Infinite Scrolling with AJAX
item.description: Ruby on Rails and jQuery team up to allow your visitors to scroll through all your content without initially loading them all.

item.title: Finding Your Most Active Users
item.description: Google Analytics is normally used to track a website's visitors and pageviews, but it can also track specific users, which can be invaluable information as you develop your customer base. Who is the most active? What are they using? Whose usage is fading?

item.title: Ajax Toggle Buttons
item.description: How to create toggle buttons using Ruby on Rails, ajax, and unobtrusive javascript. Straight-forward and boring, just how I like it.
